bugs.title: CVE-2019-13226 deepin-clone: predictable path in the Helper::temporaryMountDevice() function enabling a symlink exploit

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13226 deepin-clone: predictable path in the Helper::temporaryMountDevice() function enabling a symlink exploit

long_desc.thetext:
deepin-clone before 1.1.3 uses a predictable path /tmp/.deepin-clone/mount/<block-dev-basename> in the Helper::temporaryMountDevice() function to temporarily mount a file system as root. An unprivileged user can prepare a symlink at this location to have the file system mounted in an arbitrary location. By winning a race condition, the attacker can also enter the mount point, thereby preventing a subsequent unmount of the file system.

External Reference:

https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1130388

Created deepin-clone tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-30 [bug 1730301]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13226 deepin-clone: predictable path in the Helper::temporaryMountDevice() function enabling a symlink exploit [fedora-30]

deepin-clone before 1.1.3 uses a predictable path /tmp/.deepin-clone/mount/<block-dev-basename> in the Helper::temporaryMountDevice() function to temporarily mount a file system as root. An unprivileged user can prepare a symlink at this location to have the file system mounted in an arbitrary location. By winning a race condition, the attacker can also enter the mount point, thereby preventing a subsequent unmount of the file system.

External Reference:

https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1130388

Created deepin-clone tracking bugs for this issue:

that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-30.

against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the

=====

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13227 deepin-clone: log file at the fixed path created as root leads to a symlink attack

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13227 deepin-clone: log file at the fixed path created as root leads to a symlink attack

long_desc.thetext:
In GUI mode, deepin-clone before 1.1.3 creates a log file at the fixed path /tmp/.deepin-clone.log as root, and follows symlinks there. An unprivileged user can prepare a symlink attack there to create or overwrite files in arbitrary file system locations. The content is not attacker controlled.

External Reference:

https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1130388

Created deepin-clone tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-30 [bug 1730307]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13229 deepin-clone: fixed path in the Helper::getPartitionSizeInfo() function allows symlink attack

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13229 deepin-clone: fixed path in the Helper::getPartitionSizeInfo() function allows symlink attack

long_desc.thetext:
deepin-clone before 1.1.3 uses a fixed path /tmp/partclone.log in the Helper::getPartitionSizeInfo() function to write a log file as root, and follows symlinks there. An unprivileged user can prepare a symlink attack there to create or overwrite files in arbitrary file system locations. The content is not attacker controlled.

External References:

https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1130388

Created deepin-clone tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-30 [bug 1730309]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13228 deepin-clone: fixed path in the BootDoctor::fix() function allows symlink attack

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13228 deepin-clone: fixed path in the BootDoctor::fix() function allows symlink attack

long_desc.thetext:
deepin-clone before 1.1.3 uses a fixed path /tmp/repo.iso in the BootDoctor::fix() function to download an ISO file, and follows symlinks there. An unprivileged user can prepare a symlink attack there to create or overwrite files. The content is not attacker controlled. By winning a race condition to replace the /tmp/repo.iso symlink by an attacker controlled ISO file, further privilege escalation may be possible.

External References:

https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1130388

Created deepin-clone tracking bugs for this issue:
